content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="StreamNet_Tabs.xsl"?> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>StreamNet Project</origin>         <pubdate>20120201</pubdate>         <title>StreamNet Generalized Fish Distribution, Winter Steelhead (January 2012)</title>         <edition>v 7.0</edition>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Portland, OR</pubplace>           <publish>StreamNet, Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission</publish>         </pubinfo>         <onlink>ftp://ftp.streamnet.org/pub/streamnet/gisdata/map_data_biological/StreamNet_FishDist_July2010.zip</onlink>         <onlink>ftp://ftp.streamnet.org/pub/streamnet/gisdata/map_data_biological/StreamNet_FishDist_July2010.zip</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>This dataset is a record of fish distribution and activity for WINTER STEELHEAD contained in the StreamNet database. This feature class was created based on linear event data extracted from the StreamNet database on January 12, 2012. Distribution is based upon the best professional judgement of local fish biologists, in the Pacific Northwest Region (Oregon, Washington, Idaho and Montana). These data were collected by biologists at the state fish & wildlife agencies of Washington (WDFW), Oregon (ODFW), Idaho (IDFG) and Montana (MFWP). Data were then compiled by StreamNet staff into paper maps or event tables at the state level. These event tables were submitted to the StreamNet regional staff at Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commision (PSMFC) where this regional distribution feature class was created from the source route event tables. All data is referenced to StreamNet's Best Available Mixed-Scale Routed Hydrography as of January 2012 (MSHv3) on the LLID-based stream routing system.</abstract>       <purpose>These data are intended for use in a variety of applications where fish distribution and activity is important. Note that the StreamNet database contains distribution information for numerous species. Within the source database, overlap does not exist for a particular species/run/subrun combination. See information under the spatial process log for specific information regarding the query that was used to construct this particular feature class.</purpose>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>20120201</caldate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>publication date</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>Annually</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-125.396269</westbc>         <eastbc>-120.443875</eastbc>         <northbc>49.063005</northbc>         <southbc>41.817953</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>None</themekt>         <themekey>salmon</themekey>         <themekey>anadromous fish distribution</themekey>         <themekey>generalized fish distribution</themekey>         <themekey>resident fish distribution</themekey>         <themekey>species distribution</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>None</placekt>         <placekey>Columbia River Basin</placekey>         <placekey>MT</placekey>         <placekey>Pacific Northwest</placekey>         <placekey>WA</placekey>         <placekey>Oregon</placekey>         <placekey>Montana</placekey>         <placekey>Idaho</placekey>         <placekey>Washington</placekey>         <placekey>OR</placekey>         <placekey>ID</placekey>       </place>       <theme>         <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Categories</themekt>         <themekey>biota</themekey>         <themekey>environment</themekey>         <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>       </theme>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>Data are collected at various scales by StreamNet's partners. Only streams that are included in StreamNet's Mixed-Scale Hydrography LLID-based routing system make it into this feature class. Smaller tributaries that are not included in this routing system are not included in this layer - however, every effort is made to add streams to the route system to provide coverage where fish data is available. This dataset represents believed instances of fish distribution or habitat that likely supports fish distribution, and as every stream has not been fully evaluated, this is not an all-inclusive list of fish distribution in this region. Each line included in this feature class represents a stream segment of suitable habitat currently believed to be utilized by wild, natural, and/or hatchery fish populations and/or streams where sightings of wild, natural, and/or hatchery fish have been documented..</useconst>     <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntorgp>           <cntorg>Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission</cntorg>           <cntper>StreamNet Regional GIS Specialist</cntper>         </cntorgp>         <cntpos>StreamNet Regional GIS Specialist</cntpos>         <cntaddr>           <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype>           <address>205 SE Spokane Street, Suite 100</address>           <city>Portland</city>           <state>OR</state>           <postal>97202</postal>           <country>US</country>         </cntaddr>         <cntvoice>(503) 595-3100</cntvoice>         <cntfax>(503) 595-3232</cntfax>         <cntemail>StreamNetGIS@psmfc.org</cntemail>         <hours>9:00 AM to 5:00 PM</hours>       </cntinfo>     </ptcontac>     <browse>       <browsen>http://map.streamnet.org/sn_logo.jpg</browsen>       <browsed>StreamNet Logo</browsed>       <browset>JPEG</browset>     </browse>     <datacred>Data was compiled by the StreamNet project (<http://www.streamnet.org>), which is administered by the Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission. Data was provided by Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife, Oregon Dept. of Fish and Wildlife, Idaho Dept. of Fish and Game and Montana Fish Wildlife and Parks.</datacred>     <native>Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.3.3600</native>     <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <origin>StreamNet</origin>         <pubdate>20100515</pubdate>         <title>GeneralizedFishDistribution table (January 12, 2012)</title>         <geoform>tabular digital data</geoform>         <pubinfo>           <pubplace>Portland, OR</pubplace>           <publish>StreamNet, Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commission</publish>         </pubinfo>         <othercit>This is a tabular data set of the events that were used to create this coverage.</othercit>         <onlink>http://www.StreamNet.org</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>     <crossref>       <citeinfo>         <origin>StreamNet</origin>         <pubdate>20100515</pubdate>         <title>StreamNet Mixed-Scale Hydrography (v3 - January 2012)</title>         <edition>v2</edition>         <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>         <othercit>This is the base hydrography used to map these events.</othercit>         <onlink>http://www.streamnet.org</onlink>       </citeinfo>     </crossref>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <attracc>       <attraccr>Verified that all submitted events are mapped onto this coverage by comparing a list of individual mapped events in this derivative coverage to events in the submitted event tables (used the StockID field as the unique event identifier.). Data have been verified with source maps and is considered to be accurate for general mapping and analysis but may not be precise in places. Generally, fish distribution extents may be considered accurate within approximately 500 feet.</attraccr>     </attracc>     <logic>logically consistent (arcs connect to nodes, etc.)</logic>     <complete>complete data set</complete>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife, Idaho Department of Fish and Game, Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife, Montana Fish Wildlife and Parks</origin>             <pubdate>20120201</pubdate>             <title>StreamNet Generalized Fish Distribution Event table (FishDist)</title>             <geoform>Table</geoform>             <pubinfo>               <pubplace>Portland, OR</pubplace>               <publish>StreamNet, Pacific States Marine Fisheries Commisssion</publish>             </pubinfo>             <othercit>The latest Generalized Fish Distribution data is available through StreamNet's On-line Query System at http://www.streamnet.org/ Alternately, the StreamNet database tables can be downloaded in its entirety as a Microsoft ACCESS database from http://www.streamnet.org/</othercit>             <onlink>http://www.streamnet.org</onlink>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <srcscale>0</srcscale>         <typesrc>onLine</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <rngdates>               <begdate>20010101</begdate>               <enddate>20120201</enddate>             </rngdates>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>Generalized Fish Distribution</srccitea>         <srccontr>Spatial and attribute information</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc>Data submitted to StreamNet as tabular records (events) with LLIDs, Fmeas (Begft), and Tmeas (Endft) attributes to identify locations on streams. These data events were referenced to StreamNet's best available Mixed Scale Routed Hydrography (MSHv2) and a feature class was created based on these events. Each line segment in this feature class represents a fish distribution event record.</procdesc>
